divs: sighting detailsat 11:05 pm tuesday night nov 27th, i went out on my front porch facing east and admired the cold clear night sky. i'm looking up at a 40 degree angle and from behind a clump of trees to my right these three orbs in a line abrest east\west orientation moved rapidly from southeast to northwest and dissappeared behind the another stand of trees to my left. these objects appeared to be low as they were much larger than stars and closer to the size of a normal street lamp in size on a 30 foot pole. but not as bright. they were dim pinkish\orange elipitical orbs in shape. i immediately had goose bumps and went further into yard to try and see where they were but they had disappeared. i went inside and called my brother in fort worth texas. we had seen a saucer some 40 years earlier in daylight with binoculars hovering in the early morning light above carswell afb in fort worth. so we have seen what a true saucer looks like.
Summary: 3 spheres/orbs in line abrest, dull Pink/orange color ,low altitude moved rapidly south to north
trends: There have been 18 other sightings in Lubbock
There were no other sightings in Lubbock on or around November 27th 2007
